newsitem.title: UK: GEC to reposition as defence world leader.
newsitem.headline: GEC to reposition as defence world leader.

text.p: Britain's General Electric Co Plc said on Tuesday it was embarking on a new strategy, moving away from a joint venture culture towards a GEC-managed group focused on defence and aerospace, industrial electronics and communications.
It also said it was in active talks with Alcatel Alsthom Cie Generale d'Electricite' to determine the future of GEC Alsthom, the two companies' rail and power joint venture.
The company also unveiled annual profits before tax and exceptional charges of 1.01 billion pounds ($1.7 billion) compared with 1.00 billion previously.
The market had been looking for profits to come in at around 1.04 billion pounds.
GEC said the repositiong of its jointly-owned telecoms group GPT was under review with Siemens AG. GEC owns 60 percent of GPT and Siemens 40 percent.

"The ambitious repositioning strategy...is designed to build (GEC's defence arm) Marconi into a global player, spanning all three principle defence electronic markets - America, Europe and the East," said managing director George Simpson, who took the helm at GEC from Lord Weinstock in September 1996.

The review comes against a backdrop of mounting pressure for the European defence industry to consolidate after mega-mergers in the U.S. between Lockheed Martin Corp and Northrop Grumman Corp plus Boeing Co and McDonnell Douglas.
Simpson said the investment needed to fulfil the company's growth strategy would be financed out of GEC's cash resources. He added that any surplus cash would be remitted to shareholders.
